resources.string: "Contacts permissions are needed for providing email completions."

What do we care a lot while concreting ? Obviously the answer is “Grade of Concrete”. It is defined as the minimum strength the concrete must posses after 28 days of construction with proper quality control. Grade of concrete is denoted by prefixing M to the desired strength in MPa. The “M” denotes Mix design of concrete followed by the compressive strength number in N/mm2 “Mix” is the respective ingredient proportions which are Cement: Sand: Aggregate Or Cement: Fine Aggregate: Coarse Aggregate.For Example: If we mention M10 concrete, it means that the concrete has 10 N/mm2 characteristic compressive strength at 28 days.

M5 : Mix Ratio is 1:5:10. It is an ordinary concrete which is basically used in Plain Cement Concrete works which is used to provide a strong & stable base for foundation, it also provides a flat base for upcoming foundation rather than undulated base.
M7.5: Mix Ratio is 1:4:8. It is an ordinary concrete which is basically used in Plain Cement Concrete works which is used for building Construction.
M10: Mix Ratio is 1:3:6. Generally M10 is used for leveling course, and bedding for footings.
M15: Mix Ratio is 1:2:4. It is also used in same purposes as M10 but here the mix ratio creates the whole difference.
M20: Mix Ratio is 1:1.5:3. M20 is applicable for Reinforced Cement Concrete (RCC) works for slabs, beams, columns.
M25: Mix Ratio is 1 : 1 : 2. It is usually preferred for high rise building like 3 or 4 storey\'s to resist the high range load and for constructing Beam, Columns, and slabs etc.
M30: It is a standard Concrete. It is used for pathways and roadways on which heavy vehicles will be driving on regularly – such as yards, farms or HGV slipways.
M35:It is used in concrete pavements because they are designed for flexural strength.
M40: It is a strong grade of concrete that is mostly used on commercial construction sites, where it will be utilised to create foundations and beams for support and roads.
M45: It is also a Ready Mix concrete which is used primarily in building Construction.
M50: M50 Grade concrete is used in heavily reinforced structures which have to bear dynamic loading .
M55: Used in Prestressed Concrete Girders and Piers.
M60: It is used where high compressive strength is required such as high rise buildings, long span
M70: M70 concrete mix with 10% silica fume showed least abrasion loss and was selected for use in the construction project.
M80: It is used in bridges, ultra-thin white topping etc and constructions in aggressive environment e.g. Spillways of dams, coastal construction
M100: It is used in constructing building like Burj Khalifa.
